sect1.title: Gnumeric Keybindings
sect1.para:
Keybindings are combinations of keystrokes which tell an application to run a task. These can greatly speed-up the user's interactions with an application. Some of the most common ones are
Ctrl s
to save a file or
Ctrl q
to quit the application. Gnumeric also comes with keybindings to make your spreadsheet exprience faster.

Normally, keybindings are next to a command in a menu. For example, if
Save
has
Ctl s
next to it, that means that
Ctl s
can be typed at the same time to save your file. However, some keystrokes aren't listed in the menus. They are as follows:

listitem.para: F2 sets the current cell for editing. The cursor is inserted at the end of the current text.
F3 opens the Load file dialog window.
Ctl-F3 opens the Define Name dialog window.
F5 opens the Go to dialog window which allows you to jump to a specified cell.
F6 opens the Search and Replace dialog where you can search through your spreadsheets for text strings and replace them with something else.
F7 opens the Search Center. The Search Center allows you to search through your spreadsheets for text strings.
Ctl-~ Formats the current selection as a number.
Ctl-$ Formats the current selection with the default currency
Ctl-# Formats the current selection with default date style
Ctl-^ Formats the current selection as using scientific notation
Ctl-@ Formats the current selection with the default time format
Ctl-! Formats the current selection with the default accounting format
Ctl-& Adds a thin border around the current selection
Ctl-_ Removes any borders around or in the current selection
Ctl-$ Formats the current selection as the default currency
